last_episode_to_air.name: Marching Orders
last_episode_to_air.overview: After Hamid Hayat admits to attending a terrorist camp, lawyers and his family question whether the taped confession reveals a very different truth.

name: The Confession Tapes
overview: This true crime documentary series investigates cases where people convicted of murder claim their confessions were coerced, involuntary or false.

episodes.name: True East Part 1
episodes.overview: Following a gruesome murder, two teens are targeted by undercover police, who use a controversial technique to try to extract a confession.

episodes.name: True East Part 2
episodes.overview: As the trial for Burns and Rafay unfolds, the suspects begin to understand the massive implications of their confessions.

episodes.name: A Public Apology
episodes.overview: After his girlfriend is found murdered, a man insists he was coerced into confessing. Years later, DNA evidence tells the truth.

episodes.name: Trial by Fire
episodes.overview: A fire leads to tragedy, and the victim’s mother is accused of -- and confesses to -- murder. At trial, the defense presents an alternate theory.

episodes.name: 8th and H
episodes.overview: Police interrogate supposed gang members about a brutal attack following an anonymous tip. Oddly, no one in the neighborhood ever heard of the gang.

episodes.name: The Labor Day Murders
episodes.overview: Following a double murder, circumstantial evidence points to the victim's nephew, who endures a marathon interrogation without a lawyer.

episodes.name: Down River
episodes.overview: A man drives his four children into a river, where they drown. He wearily confesses to doing it purposefully, but later contends it was an accident.

episodes.name: Gaslight
episodes.overview: Without a lawyer to advise him, a weary truck driver confesses to murdering a 17-year-old girl following an exhausting interrogation.

episodes.name: Joyride
episodes.overview: A double murder in Nebraska sparks a hunt for those responsible and a bizarre series of interviews that raise more questions than they answer.

episodes.name: Deep Down
episodes.overview: In a long interview with police, Angelika Graswald admits to being "OK with" her fiancé drowning during a kayaking expedition. Cops and media pounce.

episodes.name: Marching Orders
episodes.overview: After Hamid Hayat admits to attending a terrorist camp, lawyers and his family question whether the taped confession reveals a very different truth.
